name: test11
description: Simple tree to illustrate the effect of variable node sizes.

name: test18
description: Same as test11, but uses the default separation

name: test01
description: One (of many) randomly generated trees, for testing

name: test19
description: Same as test01, but with custom spacing. Note how the spacing is based on the root node's size.

description: Another randomly generated tree

description: Another randomly generated tree

description: Another randomly generated tree

description: Another randomly generated tree

name: test07
description: From Figure 6 of "Drawing Non-layered Tidy Trees in Linear Time".

name: test08
description: Mirror image of test07, illustrating that "aesthetic 5" is satisfied.

name: test30
description: Same as test08, but with custom spacing

name: test10
description: Same tree as test09, uses node-size-function instead of fixed. Results are identical.

name: test16
description: Same tree as test09, but uses separation-1 instead of spacing-0. Results are again identical.

name: test17
description: Same tree as test09, but uses separation-1 and node-size-function. Results are again identical.

name: test20
description: A tree with fixed node sizes, layed out using the default size (which specifies the size of the whole drawing), and default separation. The next several tests use the same tree, with varying permutations of these variables. They comprise regression tests (that this new tree layout implementation works identically to the old one) and test that the new spacing(0) function works the same as separation(1), for fixed-node-size trees.

name: test12
description: Same tree as test20, but with a fixed separation of 1.

name: test13
description: Same tree as test20, layed out with fixed, specified node size, and fixed separation of 1.

name: test14
description: Same tree as test20, uses a custom (drawing) size, and fixed separation of 1.

name: test15
description: Same tree as test20, fixed node size; default separation.

name: test21
description: Same tree as test20, default size, with a spacing function of 0 (which works the same as separation-1, for fixed-node-sized trees).

name: test22
description: Same tree as test20, default size, custom spacing.

name: test23
description: Same tree as test20, custom drawing size, default separation.

name: test24
description: Same tree as test20, custom drawing size, spacing-0.

name: test25
description: Same tree as test20, custom drawing size, custom spacing.

name: test26
description: Same tree as test20, fixed node size, custom spacing.

name: test27
description: The simplest tree there is (useful for debugging).

name: test28
description: Another simple one, with fixed node size.

name: test29
description: Same as test28, but with default size. Note that the fact that this is not square, even though the default size is 1X1, is an artifact of the way current D3 tree layout algorithm works - it doesn't take into account the y-size of the nodes.

name: flare
description: Finally, here's the often-seen "flare" data, rendered with variable node size. This is for demo only, not used in testing.

name: grandkids1
description: Layout bug - grandkids push leftmost uncle

name: grandkids2
description: Layout bug - note the x-position of the uncle is the same as the leftmost grandkid

name: zombo
description: Zombo's tree.
